name: gravitee-apim
long_description: Gravitee.io APIM - Management API - APIs: This is the OpenAPI specification for our new version of APIM Management API.

tools.name: AP-is-list-apis
tools.description:
List APIs Get the list of APIs for a specific environment.
The results are paginated. User must have the ENVIRONMENT_API[READ] permission.

tools.name: AP-is-create-api
tools.description:
Create an API ⚠️ Support only v4 API for the moment. ⚠️
Create a new API. User must have the ENVIRONMENT_API[CREATE] permission.

tools.name: AP-is-create-api-from-swagger
tools.description:
Import API definition ⚠️ Support only v4 API for the moment. ⚠️
Create an API by importing from an Open API descriptor.
This definition can be retrieved from \`GET /environments/{envId}/apis/{apiId}/_export/definition\` User must have the ENVIRONMENT_API[CREATE] permission.

tools.name: AP-is-create-api-with-import-definition
tools.description:
Import API definition ⚠️ Support only v4 API for the moment. ⚠️
Create an API by importing an API definition.
This definition can be retrieved from \`GET /environments/{envId}/apis/{apiId}/_export/definition\` User must have the ENVIRONMENT_API[CREATE] permission.

tools.name: AP-is-search-apis
tools.description:
Search APIs Search APIs for a specific environment.
The results are paginated and can be sorted. User must have the ENVIRONMENT_API[READ] permission.

tools.name: AP-is-verify-paths
tools.description:
Verify HTTP API paths Verify paths before creating or updating a HTTP API.
This will check paths and hosts (depending on environment domain restrictions), and will check that path is not already used by other APIs in the environment.
The result will indicate if the paths are OK, and give the reason of the failure if they are not (path contains invalid chars, path is already covered by another API,...)

tools.name: AP-is-verify-hosts
tools.description:
Verify TCP and Kafka API hosts Verify hosts before creating or updating a TCP or Kafka API.
This will check it is not already used by other APIs in the environment.
The result will indicate if the hosts are OK, and give the reason of the failure if they are not.

tools.name: AP-is-get-api
tools.description:
Get a specific API

Get a specific API.

User must have at least one management (create, update, or delete) permission on the API to access it.

tools.name: AP-is-update-api
tools.description:
Update an API

Update a V2 or a V4 API.

User must have API_DEFINITION[UPDATE] or API_GATEWAY_DEFINITION[UPDATE] permissions.

tools.name: AP-is-delete-api
tools.description:
Delete an API

Delete a V2 or a V4 API.

User must have API_DEFINITION[DELETE] permission.

tools.name: AP-is-get-api-background
tools.description:
Get an API's background picture

Get the API's background picture.

User must have the API_DEFINITION[READ] permission.

tools.name: AP-is-update-api-background
tools.description:
Update an API's background

Update the API's background.

User must have the API_DEFINITION[UPDATE] permission.

tools.name: AP-is-delete-api-background
tools.description:
Delete an API's background

Delete the API's background.

User must have the API_DEFINITION[UPDATE] permission.

tools.name: AP-is-create-api-deployment
tools.description:
Request a deployment to gateway instances Request a deployment for a given API.
An optional deployment label can be given to the requested deployment. User must have the API_DEFINITION[UPDATE] permission.

tools.name: AP-is-get-current-api-deployment
tools.description:
Get the current deployment of an API

Get the current deployment of an API.

User must have the API_DEFINITION[READ] permission.

tools.name: AP-is-get-api-picture
tools.description:
Get an API's picture

Get the API's picture.

User must have the API_DEFINITION[READ] permission.

tools.name: AP-is-update-api-picture
tools.description:
Update an API's picture

Update the API's picture.

User must have the API_DEFINITION[UPDATE] permission.

tools.name: AP-is-delete-api-picture
tools.description:
Delete an API's picture

Delete the API's picture.

User must have the API_DEFINITION[UPDATE] permission.

tools.name: AP-is-get-api-metadata
tools.description:
Get metadata pertaining to API

Get the metadata that pertains to an API. Can be global and API metadata.

User must have the API_METADATA[READ] permission.

tools.name: AP-is-export-api-definition
tools.description:
Export an API ⚠️ Support only v4 API for the moment. ⚠️ Export an API to a JSON file. User must have at least the API_DEFINITION[READ] permission.
User should also have these permissions for specific data: - API_DEFINITION[READ] for the API - API_MEMBER[READ] for the API's members - API_PLAN[READ] for the API's plans - API_METADATA[READ] for the API's metadata - API_DOCUMENTATION[READ] for the API's documentation pages

tools.name: AP-is-start-api
tools.description:
Start an API

Change the API's status to STARTED.

Return a 400 HTTP Error:
 - when user tries to start an ARCHIVED API
 - when the API is already STARTED
 - when the API needs to be reviewed (only if Review feature is activated).

User must have the API_DEFINITION[UPDATE] permission.

tools.name: AP-is-stop-api
tools.description:
Stop an API

Change the API's status to STOPPED.

Return a 400 HTTP Error:
 - when user tries to stop an ARCHIVED API
 - when the API is already STOPPED.

User must have the API_DEFINITION[UPDATE] permission.

tools.name: AP-is-transfer-ownership
tools.description:
Transfer the ownership of the API

Transfer the ownership of the API to a user, a group or an api member.

Return a 404 HTTP Error if API cannot be found.

Return a 400 HTTP Error:
 - when user tries to stop an ARCHIVED API
 - when the API is already STOPPED.

User must have the API_MEMBER[UPDATE] permission.

tools.name: AP-is-duplicate-api
tools.description:
Duplicate an API

Create a new API from an existing one.
Context-path is required for HTTP APIs and host is required for TCP APIs. If one of these fields is missing, then it returns a 400 Bad Request.
User must have at least the API_DEFINITION[READ] and ENVIRONMENT_API[CREATE] permissions.

tools.name: AP-is-rollback-api
tools.description:
Rollback an API

Rollback an API to a previous version.

User must have the API_DEFINITION[UPDATE] permission.

tools.name: AP-is-reviews-ask
tools.description:
Ask for a review

Ask for a review

Return a 400 HTTP Error:
 - when user tries to change reviews state of an ARCHIVED API
 - when user tries to change reviews state of an API already in review

User must have the API_DEFINITION[UPDATE] permission.

tools.name: AP-is-reviews-accept
tools.description:
Accept a review

Accept a review

Return a 400 HTTP Error:
 - when user tries to change reviews state of an ARCHIVED API
 - when user tries to change reviews state of an API that is not in review

User must have the API_REVIEWS[UPDATE] permission.

tools.name: AP-is-reviews-reject
tools.description:
Reject a review

Reject a review

Return a 400 HTTP Error:
 - when user tries to change reviews state of an ARCHIVED API
 - when user tries to change reviews state of an API that is not in review

User must have the API_REVIEWS[UPDATE] permission.

tools.name: API-subscriptions-verify-api-deployment
tools.description:
Check if a deployment is possible

Check if an API deployment is possible given the API's definition and license used by the organization.

User must have the API_DEFINITION[READ] permission.

tools.name: API-subscriptions-get-api-subscribers
tools.description:
Get the API's subscribers List applications that have subscribed to a given API.
The results are paginated. User must have API_SUBSCRIPTION[READ] permissions to access endpoint.

tools.name: API-subscriptions-get-api-subscriptions
tools.description:
Get the API's subscriptions

List subscriptions for a given API, always filtered by a \`status\` and the possibility to filter by \`security\`.

User must have API_SUBSCRIPTION[READ] permissions to access endpoint.

tools.name: API-subscriptions-create-api-subscription
tools.description:
Subscribe to an API's plan

Create a new subscription on a given API.

User must have the API_SUBSCRIPTION[CREATE] permission.

tools.name: API-subscriptions-export-api-subscriptions
tools.description:
Export API subscriptions as CSV

Export API subscriptions to a CSV file.

User must have the API_SUBSCRIPTION[READ] permission.

tools.name: API-subscriptions-verify-create-api-subscription
tools.description:
Check a subscription can be created

Check a subscription can be created with given API Key, and application.

User must have the API_SUBSCRIPTION[CREATE] permission.

tools.name: API-subscriptions-get-api-subscription
tools.description:
Get one API's subscription

Get the API's subscription by its identifier.

User must have the API_SUBSCRIPTION[READ] permission.

tools.name: API-subscriptions-update-api-subscription
tools.description:
Update one API's subscription

Update the API's subscription.

User must have the API_SUBSCRIPTION[UPDATE] permission.

tools.name: API-subscriptions-close-api-subscription
tools.description:
Close one API's subscription

Close the API's subscription.

User must have the API_SUBSCRIPTION[UPDATE] permission.

tools.name: API-subscriptions-pause-api-subscription
tools.description:
Pause one API's subscription

Pause the API's subscription.

User must have the API_SUBSCRIPTION[UPDATE] permission.

tools.name: API-subscriptions-resume-api-subscription
tools.description:
Resume a paused API's subscription

Resume a previously paused subscription.

User must have the API_SUBSCRIPTION[UPDATE] permission.

tools.name: API-subscriptions-accept-api-subscription
tools.description:
Accept an API subscription

Accept an API subscription with an optional starting / ending dates and reason.

User must have the API_SUBSCRIPTION[UPDATE] permission.

tools.name: API-subscriptions-reject-api-subscription
tools.description:
Reject an API subscription

Reject an API subscription with an optional reason.

User must have the API_SUBSCRIPTION[UPDATE] permission.

tools.name: API-subscriptions-transfer-api-subscription
tools.description:
Transfer an API subscription Transfer an API subscription to another plan.
The targeted plan must be published and must have the same security type. Transfer cannot be performed if general conditions apply to the targeted plan. User must have the API_SUBSCRIPTION[UPDATE] permission.

tools.name: API-subscriptions-get-api-subscription-api-keys
tools.description:
Get subscription's API Keys

Get the subscription API Keys.

User must have the API_SUBSCRIPTION[READ] permission.

tools.name: API-subscriptions-renew-api-subscription-api-keys
tools.description:
Renew the subscription API Keys. Renew the subscription API Key by setting an expiration date on the existing active API Keys and creating a new API Key.
The newly created API Key is returned in response. User must have the API_SUBSCRIPTION[UPDATE] permission.

tools.name: API-subscriptions-update-api-subscription-api-key
tools.description:
Update a subscription API Key

Update the subscription API Key.

User must have the API_SUBSCRIPTION[UPDATE] permission.

tools.name: API-subscriptions-revoke-api-subscription-api-key
tools.description:
Revoke a subscription API Key Revoke the subscription API Key by setting the revocation date to the current date and flagging it as revoked.
A notification will be sent to the subscriber according to his portal notification options. User must have the API_SUBSCRIPTION[UPDATE] permission.

tools.name: API-subscriptions-reactivate-api-subscription-api-key
tools.description:
Reactivate subscription API Key

Reactivate the revoked or expired subscription API Key.

User must have the API_SUBSCRIPTION[UPDATE] permission.

tools.name: API-members-list-api-members
tools.description:
Get the API's members

List the members for a given API.

User must have the API_MEMBER[READ] permission.

tools.name: API-members-add-api-member
tools.description:
Add a member to an API.

Add a new member to an API.

Returns a 400 HTTP Error:
 - when the user tries to set a member as PrimaryOwner.

tools.name: API-members-update-api-member

User must have the API_MEMBER[UPDATE] permission.

Remove an API member.

Returns a 400 HTTP Error:
 - when the user tries to remove a PrimaryOwner.

User must have the API_MEMBER[DELETE] permission.

tools.name: integrations-list-integrations
tools.description:
List Integrations Get the list of Integration for a specific environment.
The results are paginated. User must have the ENVIRONMENT_INTEGRATION[READ] permission.

tools.name: integrations-create-integration
tools.description:
Create an Integration

Create a new Integration.

The response body will not contain Agent Status. To get it you should use getIntegration operation.
User must have the ENVIRONMENT_INTEGRATION[CREATE] permission.

tools.name: integrations-get-integration
tools.description:
Get a specific Integration

Get a specific Integration.

tools.name: integrations-update-integration
tools.description:
Update Integration

Update specific Integration.

The response body will not contain Agent Status. To get it you should use getIntegration operation.
User must have ENVIRONMENT_INTEGRATION[UPDATE] permission to access it.

tools.name: integrations-delete-integration
tools.description:
Delete Integration

Delete specific integration

To delete integration user must have ENVIRONMENT_INTEGRATION[DELETE] permission.
Deletion is not possible if there is any federated API associated.

tools.name: integrations-ingest-integration
tools.description:
Ingest APIs for a specific Integration

Ingest all APIs for a specific Integration.

tools.name: integrations-preview-integration
tools.description:
Preview APIs to ingest for a specific Integration

Preview APIs to ingest before actual ingestion.

User must have both the ENVIRONMENT_INTEGRATION[READ] and the ENVIRONMENT_API[CREATE] permission 
to perform ingestion preview.

tools.name: integrations-ingested-apis
tools.description:
Get list of ingested APIs associated to integration

Get a list of all APIs that were ingested from 3rd party provider using this integration. 

User must have the ENVIRONMENT_INTEGRATION[READ] permission.

tools.name: integrations-delete-ingested-apis
tools.description:
Delete ingested APIs associated to integration

Delete APIs that were ingested from 3rd party provider using this integration. 

To delete APIs user must have ENVIRONMENT_API[DELETE] permission.
Only unpublished APIs will deleted. APIs that are published will be omitted!

tools.name: API-documentation-get-api-pages
tools.description:
Get API documentation pages

Get API documentation pages.
When no parentId is specified, returns all the pages of the API.

When parentId is specified (either ID of a folder, or 'ROOT'), only the pages with the given parent are returned, 
and the breadcrumb of the specified folder is added to the response. 

User must have the API_DOCUMENTATION[READ] permission.

tools.name: API-documentation-create-documentation-page
tools.description:
Create API documentation page

Create API documentation. The result will be the created page or folder.
Only MARKDOWN and FOLDER types are supported.

User must have the API_DOCUMENTATION[CREATE] permission.

tools.name: API-documentation-get-api-page
tools.description:
Get API Documentation Page

User must have the API_DOCUMENTATION[READ] permission.

tools.name: API-documentation-update-documentation-page
tools.description:
Update API documentation page

Only MARKDOWN and FOLDER types are supported.

User must have the API_DOCUMENTATION[CREATE] permission.

tools.name: API-documentation-delete-documentation-page
tools.description:
Delete API documentation page

Delete API documentation page.
A FOLDER will be deleted only if it is empty.

tools.name: API-documentation-publish-documentation-page

User must have the API_DOCUMENTATION[UPDATE] permission.

tools.name: API-documentation-unpublish-documentation-page
tools.description:
Unpublish API Documentation Page

User must have the API_DOCUMENTATION[UPDATE] permission.

tools.name: API-documentation-fetch-documentation-page
tools.description:
Fetch Content of API Documentation Page

Fetch Content of API Documentation Page. Returns the page with newly fetched content.
The page must have a configured source, otherwise an error is returned.

User must have the API_DOCUMENTATION[UPDATE] permission.
